COURSES.name: Criticism of Art
COURSES.description: Reviews principal theories in the history of criticism. Analysis and evaluation of works of art. Problems in the criticism of contemporary art. Required for art history majors. (H)
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ARH 2050 and ARH 2051, and art major or art history minor.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Early Twentieth Century Art
COURSES.description: European and American art from Post-Impressionism to 1945. Emphasis on painting and sculpture. (H)
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ARH 2051, and art major or art history minor.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Color Drawing
COURSES.description: Explores color theory and color usages in drawing. Emphasis on techniques, strategies and materials.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 2305C, ART 2374C and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Figure Drawing 2
COURSES.description: Comprehensive study of the figure from observation of live models. Study of anatomy, composition and conceptual strategies.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 2330C and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Experimental Drawing
COURSES.description: Exposure to unfamiliar materials and techniques both antique and modern. Invention strategies and contemporary motivating factors explored.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 2305C, ART 2374C and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Sketch Journal: Uses and Development
COURSES.description: Historic and contemporary uses of sketch journals. Exploration of notation, studies, invention and conceptualization in sketchbook drawing techniques.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: ART 2305C, ART 2374C and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Painting: Structure and Transformation
COURSES.description: Examines form and structure theory in painting and its application in development of idea and painterly process.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: two of three from ART 2500C, ART 2501C and ART 2503C, and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Painting: Exploring the Series
COURSES.description: Development of idea through the creation of series, groups and suites.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: two of three from ART 2500C, ART 2501C and ART 2503C, and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Figure Painting
COURSES.description: The human figure serves as a formal and expressive motif as well as a departure point for creating individual painting statements.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: two of three from ART 2500C, ART 2501C and ART 2503C, and junior-level art major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Projects in Painting: Experiments in Media
COURSES.description: Students contract with their instructor to create a body of work in painting, experimenting with materials and methods related to disciplines in painting.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: two of the following: ART 2500C, ART 2501C and ART 2503C, or instructor permission.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Digital Art and Animation 1
COURSES.description: Explores time-based computer art including animation, interactive and Internet-based projects.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Machine Sculpture
COURSES.description: Explores the boundaries of physical and electronic media including the use of sound, light, computers and motion in sculpture.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ART 3842C or a 3000-level sculpture course.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Video Art
COURSES.description: Explores video with an emphasis on editing and building a personal vocabulary through the electronic image.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3. Prereq: DIG 2131C, DIG 2282C and junior-level digital media major.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Advanced Drawing
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3 to 6; can be repeated with change in content; Prereq: ART 3310C, ART 3330C, ART 3380C and ART 3381C.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Advanced Painting
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 6; can be repeated with change in content. Prereq: ART 3522C, ART 3560C and ART 3561C.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Video Art: Advanced Projects
COURSES.description: Focuses on the completion of larger scale student-directed projects with a special emphasis on pre-production planning and advanced editing techniques.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Advanced Sculpture
COURSES.description: Advanced problems in sculptural form with development of processes and techniques.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Studio Practice
COURSES.description: Rotating special topics in studio art and studio practice.

sections.deptName: New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts
New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts
New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts
New World School of the Arts-Visual Arts

COURSES.name: Internship
COURSES.description: Supervised practical experience with an art, graphic design or museum facility according to an approved program. Special seminar and evaluation sessions with faculty advisor and art facility manager. (S-U)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: arrangement with art advisor and chair and dean permission.
